isis.stitle: DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engine Service (1990) - ROCKER ARM ASSEMBLY, CAMSHAFT, TAPPETS AND PUSH RODS - CAMSHAFT, TAPPETS & PUSH RODS - CAMSHAFT BUSHING INSTALLATION

step1.para: Identify each bushing by its outside diameter. Refer to the "CAMSHAFT BUSHING CHART" which appears earlier in this section.
Lubricate the new camshaft bushings as well as the crankcase bushing bore with clean engine oil.

Install the new bushing onto the expanding collet and tighten the collet by turning the backup nut until the bushing is held securely. Refer to Figure 5.27
.

Mark the oil hole location on the back-up nut of the installation tool to aid in the alignment of the bushing and crankcase oil holes. Refer to Figure 5.28
.

note.para: This step must be repeated for each bushing installed.
THE BUSHINGS MUST BE INSTALLED IN THE PROPER ORDER BECAUSE OF THE DIFFERENT SIZE OUTSIDE DIAMETERS OF THE BUSHINGS.

step1.para:
5. Install the rear intermediate bushing through the front of the crankcase, then pull it into place at the rear of the crankcase by turning the pulling nut on the puller screw. Refer to Figure 5.29
. Remove the tool and inspect oil hole alignment.

figure.caption: Figure 5.27 Install Bushing on Installer Tool.

step1.para:
Install the front intermediate bushing next. Install through the front of the crankcase and pull into place from the rear. Refer to Figure 5.29
.
Next install the front camshaft bushing by pulling it into place from the rear.
The rear camshaft bushing must be pulled into place from the front of the crankcase.

note.para: ALL BUSHING OIL HOLES MUST BE IN ALIGNMENT WITH THE OIL HOLES IN THE CRANKCASE.
